channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump says U.S. envoy returning to Moscow for new Ukraine peace talks
item.description: President Trump says says his envoy Steve Witkoff will resume talks with Putin amid hopes for a Ukraine peace deal, even as leaked transcripts raise questions about Witkoff's role as a mediator.
item.content:encoded: President Trump says says his envoy Steve Witkoff will resume talks with Putin amid hopes for a Ukraine peace deal, even as leaked transcripts raise questions about Witkoff's role as a mediator.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Ukraine's ambassador to the U.S. on peace plan negotiations between the two countries
item.description: NPR's A Martinez talks to Olga Stefanishyna, Ukraine's ambassador to the U.S., about the proposed peace plan to end the Ukraine war, and whether Ukrainians will support it.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez talks to Olga Stefanishyna, Ukraine's ambassador to the U.S., about the proposed peace plan to end the Ukraine war, and whether Ukrainians will support it.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Two National Guard members were shot in a "targeted attack" in D.C., Georgia election interference case against Trump, allies dismissed, U.S. envoy to return to Moscow for new Ukraine peace talks.
item.content:encoded: Two National Guard members were shot in a "targeted attack" in D.C., Georgia election interference case against Trump, allies dismissed, U.S. envoy to return to Moscow for new Ukraine peace talks.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: For many, the holidays this year means having to make do with less
item.description: With job losses, food benefit reductions and higher prices, many in the U.S. are having to scrimp this holiday season.
item.content:encoded:
With job losses, food benefit reductions and higher prices, many in the U.S. are having to scrimp this holiday season.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: An Ecuadorian-style Thanksgiving: Recreating holiday memories of a childhood recipe
item.description: Chef Rick Martinez, a James Beard award winner, helped an NPR host recreate a beloved Ecuadorian dish his family ate during Thanksgiving. Here's the recipe.
item.content:encoded:
Chef Rick Martinez, a James Beard award winner, helped an NPR host recreate a beloved Ecuadorian dish his family ate during Thanksgiving. Here's the recipe.

(Image credit: A Martinez)
item.dc:creator: Barry Gordemer

item.title: Pope Leo XIV embarks on first overseas trip, visiting Turkey and Lebanon
item.description: One journalist gifted Pope Leo XIV a Thanksgiving pumpkin pie as he began his first overseas tour to Turkey and Lebanon, accompanied by the world's press.
item.content:encoded:
One journalist gifted Pope Leo XIV a Thanksgiving pumpkin pie as he began his first overseas tour to Turkey and Lebanon, accompanied by the world's press.

(Image credit: Domenico Stinellis)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Feeling financial stress this holiday season? Here are some ways to manage it
item.description: Financial uncertainty is causing anxiety for many this holiday season. NPR's A Martinez asks a personal finance journalist for tips on holiday shopping this year.
item.content:encoded: Financial uncertainty is causing anxiety for many this holiday season. NPR's A Martinez asks a personal finance journalist for tips on holiday shopping this year.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: At least 55 killed, hundreds missing after Hong Kong high-rise blaze
item.description: A massive fire tore through a high-rise housing complex in Hong Kong on Wednesday. Authorities say at least 55 people have died in the fire and 279 people are still missing.
item.content:encoded: A massive fire tore through a high-rise housing complex in Hong Kong on Wednesday. Authorities say at least 55 people have died in the fire and 279 people are still missing.
item.dc:creator: Sherisse Pham

item.title: Before trick-or-treating, kids sought treats on Thanksgiving for Ragamuffin Day
item.description: Before Halloween was known for trick-or-treating, there was Ragamuffin Day. A Thanksgiving day celebration that involved children wearing costumes and going door-to-door, begging for treats.
item.content:encoded: Before Halloween was known for trick-or-treating, there was Ragamuffin Day. A Thanksgiving day celebration that involved children wearing costumes and going door-to-door, begging for treats.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Americans living abroad share how they celebrate Thanksgiving
item.description: From tracking down a turkey to sharing a piece of home with new friends, Americans living overseas share how they celebrate Thanksgiving.
item.content:encoded: From tracking down a turkey to sharing a piece of home with new friends, Americans living overseas share how they celebrate Thanksgiving.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez
